fields.description:
After updating UPM to 2.17.4, a lot of warning messages are seen in atlassian-jira.log as follows:
{noformat}
2014-07-10 22:03:24,564 http-bio-8080-exec-24 WARN admin 1323x713x1 1m4fac5 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /plugins/servlet/upm [atlassian.plugin.webresource.DefaultResourceDependencyResolver] Cannot find web resource module for: com.atlassian.upm.atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin:notificationsDataProvider
2014-07-10 22:03:24,750 http-bio-8080-exec-24 WARN anonymous 1323x714x1 1m4fac5 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e/en_USmwjg9v-1988229788/6265/29/26462200194436ad2c1586e276fab000/_/download/contextbatch/css/atl.admin,jira.global/batch.css [atlassian.plugin.webresource.DefaultResourceDependencyResolver] Cannot find web resource module for: com.atlassian.upm.atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin:notificationsDataProvider
2014-07-10 22:03:24,753 http-bio-8080-exec-22 WARN anonymous 1323x719x6 1m4fac5 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e/en_USmwjg9v-1988229788/6265/29/26462200194436ad2c1586e276fab000/_/download/contextbatch/js/atl.admin,jira.global/batch.js [atlassian.plugin.webresource.DefaultResourceDependencyResolver] Cannot find web resource module for: com.atlassian.upm.atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin:notificationsDataProvider
2014-07-10 22:03:24,760 http-bio-8080-exec-18 WARN anonymous 1323x720x6 1m4fac5 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e/en_USmwjg9v-1988229788/6265/29/26462200194436ad2c1586e276fab000/_/download/contextbatch/js/atl.admin,jira.global/batch.js [atlassian.plugin.webresource.DefaultResourceDependencyResolver] Cannot find web resource module for: com.atlassian.upm.atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin:notificationsDataProvider
{noformat}

These warning messages are not available before the update. No unusual behavior has been recorded so far hence these might be considered unwanted warnings and should be removed to clean the log files.

HI,
I've noticed a wrong link (and a spelling error at the same time) when using the notification helper. (See screenshot)

Steps to reproduce:
# Log into JIRA
# Go to the a project administration and select Notifications
# Click the notification helper
# in the user field you can select any user ; in the issue field select an issue from a project where this user is not the project lead.
# press Submit -> The notification helper show several 'errors' and possible solutions.
# In the solution for the Project Lead you'll have a link called '<Project Name> project people confiugration' (notice the spelling error?)
#click this link, it will give an error because it's redirecting you to the following url : http://<jira-instance>/plugins/servlet/project-config/<ProjectKey>/people which does not exist.

screenshot : !error-screenshot.jpg!
fields.summary: Wrong link and spelling error in notification helper

fields.description:
Hello,

The results of those 2 filters are different 
project = dmi and created >= "2014/06/01" and created <= "2014/06/30"  =>> 382 issues created in June
project = dmi and created >=  startOfMonth(-1) and created <= endOfMonth(-1) =>> 396 issues created in June

Delta 14 issues

To find them

project = dmi and (created >=  startOfMonth(-1) and created <  startOfMonth()) and not (created >= "2014/06/01" and created <= "2014/06/30")

All issues created the 30/06 are missing in results of the first filter.
Conclusion

created < startOfMonth() gives same result than  created <= endOfMonth(-1)
But
created <= "2014/06/30" misses all issues created the 30/6.

Why ?
I'd like to know which previous version (of Jira) was in the same situation ?
Our reports aren't correct since ?

Thnak you
fields.summary: The filters seems not correct with created <= "2014/06/30"

fields.description:
If you use Java 8 to run JIRA 6.3 you can find that your outbound email addresses will be of the form jwinters@localhost rather than jwinters@atlassian.com

h4.Diagnosis
In Java 8,  getLocalHost().getHostName() behaves differently from previous Java versions depending on the order of aliases in  {{/etc/hosts}}. 

h4.Workaround
Changing the order of domain aliases in {{/etc/hosts}} to changes the return value of getHostName() in Java 8.

For example,
* If {{/etc/hosts}} is {{127.0.0.1 localhost localhost.localdomain centos57}}, then Java8 returns {{localhost}} for getHostName().
* If we rewrite this as {{127.0.0.1 centos57 localhost.localdomain localhost}} then getHostName() returns {{centos57}}.
fields.summary: JIRA from address in outbound email changed to 'localhost' if you use Java 8

fields.description: JIRA provides a yellow dialog on the UI when an issue page is open and someone else has updated it. This feature is no longer working in 6.2.4 for individual issue pages. Updates notifications are still working correctly for Agile boards when changes are made and the page has not been refreshed. This is a nice feature since pages are often left open with multiple users contributing to that page, and a user being aware of that without refreshing helps keep them informed of other user updates.
fields.summary: Update notifications not showing on web pages for issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39055].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for following this ticketing and keeping in the loop of our support of MS SQL Server 2014. We fully intend to support MS SQL Server 2014 in the near future and will inform everyone on this ticket once support has commenced. 

h5. When can I expect it?
Support for MS SQL Server 2014 will occur in the next *_minor release_* of JIRA, granted there are no unforeseen events that prevent this support. If this does occur, I will relay any information back to this ticket to keep you all informed as best I can. The next minor release for JIRA is set for *Q1 2016*. 

h5. I can't wait that long, what should I do?
If you or your organisation cannot wait until Q1 2016 for MS SQL Server 2014, I recommend updating to MS SQL Server 2012 in the interim. We will be ending support for MS SQL Server 2005 in the next major release, JIRA 7.0, and it is recommended you do not stay on this version of MS SQL Server when it comes time to upgrade. 

h5. I have more questions
Please feel free to email me or comment on this issue and I'll do my best to get back to you as soon as I can.

Thank you for your understanding and patience. :) 

Regards,
Kerrod Williams
JIRA Product Management
kewilliams at atlassian dot com  
{panel}

///

h3. Summary
Microsoft SQL Server 2014 is not certified/supported for use with recent versions of JIRA. JIRA Administrators should able to migrate onto recent versions of Microsoft SQL Server in order to maintain compliance with internal policies within SOE's. 

h3. Environment
SQL Server, 2014, with recent versions of JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
N/A

h3. Expected Results
JIRA Should Support Microsoft SQL Server 2014.

h3. Actual Results
[Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms] does not list SQL Server 2014 as a supported Database.
fields.summary: Official Support for MS SQL Server 2014

fields.description:
One of our JIRA users, who is not a global admin, created a new Dashboard and about 4 new filters. He did not choose to share the Dashboard or filters so I assume they are private. He wanted to share his dashboard and doesn't have that permission when he "edits" the dashboard. Therefore, as a global admin, I logged in and was going to share the Dashboard for him. However, when I search for the Dashboard it's not found. When I search for the filters he created they are also not found. As a global admin, why should those be hidden from me?

I also had another of our global admins test this and he is having the same experience I am. I'm not sure where to go from here.
fields.summary: Private Dashboard and Filters Not Viewable by Global Admins

The issues will be imported and subtasks will be created without mapping the parent issues. So orphaned subtasks will be created in JIRA.

Map the parent-subtask hierarchy from Redmine and automatically create the relationship.
fields.summary: Redmine Import allow creation of subtasks without specifying parent issues

fields.description:
Within the User Directories we have one of the type "Microsoft Active Directory".
The password for the "User to log in to LDAP" has changed, so I logged in as "Internal Directory" admin to change it.

How it happens:
1) Edit the User Directory settings
2) Write the new password
3) Hit "Test Settings"
4) Hit "Save and Test"

Unfortunately the password used by ldap is still the old one and users are unable to login.


Workaround:
1) Edit the User Directory settings
2) Write the new password
3) Hit "Test Settings"
4) Write the new password (again)
5) Hit "Save and Test"
fields.summary: User Directories - "Test Settings" replaces a new password with the old one

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

Using JQL, the fields you search for will use English names for all system fields, but translated names for all custom fields. For example when using Japanese and JIRA Agile, issuekey is in English, but sprint is in Japanese (スプリント):

!jql_field_translation.png!

This may cause confusion for users when typing JQL queries. It would be more consistent if they were all in the same language.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Install a language pack
# Switch to using that language
# Install a plugin such as JIRA Agile, which has translated custom fields
# Try to search for system and custom fields using JQL
fields.summary: When using a language pack other than English, searching with JQL, system fields are all in English, custom fields are all in the other language

fields.description:
I'm trying to pass report parameter from gadget, and then would like to keep it after going through configuration page, but it's lost.

I expected that hidden report parameter will make it work, but it does not. Is there other way to pass parameter, similarly to selectedProjectId parameter?

Scenario:

{code}
    <report ...>
            ...
            <property>
                <key>reportingDay</key>
                <name>reportingDay</name>
                <description>reportingDay</description>
                <type>hidden</type>
            </property>
        </properties>
    </report>
{code}

See also [Configuring Plugins with Object Configurable Parameters|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Configuring+Plugins+with+Object+Configurable+Parameters]

Url: {{http://localhost:2990/jira/secure/ConfigureReport!default.jspa?reportKey=jira-timesheet-plugin:projectpivot&reportingDay=2}}

But after clicking Next on report configuration page value is lost, e.g. {{http://localhost:2990/jira/secure/ConfigureReport.jspa?reportingDay=&reportKey=jira-timesheet-plugin%3Aprojectpivot&Next=Next}}
fields.summary: Report module plugin development: hidden report parameter is lost on report configuration

fields.description:
The root of the JIRA web application (e.g. "/" or "/foo/" or whatever the context path is) is a redirect to {{/secure/MyJiraHome.jspa}} (and then typically the Dashboard.jspa). However, we create a session in default.jspa (which serves the root) if one is absent.

This is never necessary, and sometimes causes the following problem with  poorly configured front-end proxies:

* Tomcat sets the {{path=}} of the JSESSIONID cookie to the context path, with a trailing slash e.g. "path=/foo/"
* If the browser goes to "/foo" (with no trailing slash) then they are not supposed to send the JSESSIONID cookie because it is not properly under "/foo/". FireFox does send it, but not of the other browsers do.
* If Tomcat sees a request to "/foo" it will redirect to "/foo/" and not pass the request to JIRA.
* If the proxy is misconfigured, it may accept "/foo" from the browser (with no cookie) and send it as "/foo/" to JIRA.
* JIRA will then create a new JSESSIONID, overwriting the old one in the browser.

This manifest as your session being dropped (e.g. getting logged out) whenever you access "/foo" (with no slash). There are various places that send you to the base url without a slash (e.g. the login gadget).
fields.summary: Do not create a session when hitting the root of the webapp

fields.description:
we set the jira.projectkey.pattern property to a pattern like 

((\d\{5})|([A-Z][A-Z0-9]+))

(yes, we didn't followed the "starting with a letter" rule, but in 4.4.5 this rule was not obvious for us).

After that ( we didn't noticed the relationship) we noticed, that rendring of issue keys (like RPL-234) in description and comments was not as a link, but as RPLnullRPL-234 ... ugly.

After investigating, I think the problem is in JiraKeyUtils.java, especially createKeyFromMatchingGroups seems to ignore the circumstance, that there can be more than 1 alternative for the project key. My workaround (see the patch file) is to change the issueKeyRegex patterns of the DefaultKeyMatcher and to change the way, the key is combined in createKeyFromMatchingGroups. For us (I think) it's working like intended now ... maybe you can use it
fields.summary: problems with issue-key rendering if custom project key pattern set

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38995].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Basic search is unavailable when performing simple JQL searches involving users who have been renamed in the past.  This effects both searching from a saved filter or from a gadget on a dashboard which may have previously worked. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user with any username
# Browse to the issue navigator and search for this user either in the "reporter" or "assignee" field
# You will be able to search either in Basic or Advanced mode
# Now rename this user with any value (adding an extra letter will work)
# Browse back to the issue navigator and, in Advanced mode, search for the user either in the "reporter" or "assignee" field
# The "Basic" search will be disabled
# If you hover over the "Basic" link, the message "This query is too complex to display in Simple mode" will be shown

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to switch between Basic and Advanced mode

h3. Actual Results
The Basic search is disabled and if you hover over the "Basic" link, the message "This query is too complex to display in Simple mode" will be shown
 
h3. Notes
If you are unsure whether a username has changed run the following SQL:
{code}select * from app_user where lower_user_name='<username>'{code}
and it will return the current and previous username

h3.Workaround
Rename the user back to the original username, or use advanced search instead
fields.summary: After renaming an user, if you search for reporter or assignee the "Basic" search is disabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38979].
  {panel}

Allow project admins to choose notification and permission scheme from fixed list.

Rather than always bugging a jira-administrator to adjust notifications/permissions, the jira-administrator could create a few sanctioned/official schemes that the Administer Projects (Project Role Administrators by default) could select from.

notificationscheme and permissionscheme need a new DB column to the effect of 'ALLOWPROJECTADJUST' or 'SANCTIONEDLIST' default NULL = 0/FALSE/NO

Thus any with NULL are not presented in a drop down list. 

(Will have to expose the button for actions > 'use a different scheme' to the Administer Projects permission).

JRA-28184 is marked as a bug in documentation, so hence this new feature request.
fields.summary: Allow project admins to choose notification and permission schemes from fixed list.

fields.description:
*steps to reproduce*
# Edit an issue without any wiki markup by clicking on the edit button (Note that the problem is not reproducible with inline edit)
# add a singular markup like h1., or bq. without making any other change to the description

*Expected Behaviour*
On clicking submit the changes to the Issue Description is updated and the wiki markup is effective

*Actual Behaviour*
The wiki markup seems not to take any effect until the page is refreshed

*Other notes*
* If you make any other changes other than the wiki markup, you wouldn't be able to reproduce the problem (that is the wiki markup will reflect correctly)
* If you add more than one wiki markup at a time, e.g. a h1. somewhere, bq. somewhere else in the description etc. this problem will not be reproducible as well.
fields.summary: Editing issue description is not updated when you add a wiki markup until refresh
Include other e-mail recipients on "Share" e-mails

fields.description:
When defining the Column layout to apply in the Issue Navigator, we are experiencing some difficulty to complete it.

When dragging a column to a new position, the graphical object which represents it, has the same width of the column header.
And the drop coordinate can not exceed the right of the screen minus this width.

Consequence : It is not possible to move the "Description" column directly to last position. The best reachable position is the 3rd position from the right (depending on the with of other columns). We have to move the other column to its left, after to complete the Column Layout definition.
fields.summary: Not possible to drag & drop large columns (Description) to the last position (right) in the Issue Navigator

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38975].
  {panel}

I was preparing a set of filters with dedicated Columns Layout.
And thinking that I was modifying the Columns Layout of the new filter, I have modified the "My Default" Columns Layout.

After having shared with the team, I had pain to understand what was the cause of this miss of Column Layout in my filter.
I have understood my error only after some debug and some SQL queries.

In order to avoid that, it will be practice to have the below behavior :
* When using a JQL query not saved as filter, only "My Default" Column Layout should be available (also System in case of Administrator)
* When using one of My Filter , only "Filter" Column Layout should be available

V.
fields.summary: It is not easy to identify the scope of Columns Layout (My, Filter or System) in Issue Navigator.

fields.description: I updated the description of Priority levels quite some time ago, but the description field is not updated on the local help windows (The one you can access by clicking on the "?" icon while creating an issue)

fields.description:
h5. Repro steps
Versions used: Confluence 5.4.4 and JIRA 6.2.2, 6.2.3 and 6.2.7.
# Set up an application link between JIRA and Confluence. In my tests I used TrustedApps as the authentication method.
# Create a project in JIRA and make sure the field _Priority_ is required.
# Go to your JIRA user profile and change the language to German.
# In Confluence, edit a page and insert the JIRA issues macro.
# In the JIRA issues dialog, select _Create New Issue and_ fill all the fields.
# Click on Insert.

h5. Problem description
When Confluence tries to create the issue you receive a 400 error from JIRA. The JSON response from JIRA is:
{noformat}[{"summary":"asdfasdfa sdaf asdf","description":"asdfasdfasdf as","projectId":"10000","issueTypeId":"1","errors":{"priority":"Prioritätsname \"Schwer\" ist ungültig"},"fields":{"priority":"{\"name\":\"Schwer\"}"}}]{noformat}

The problem seems to be that the priorities get translated and are not picked up correctly by JIRA. This may also affect other default fields with translattions.

Confluence language does not  have any effect on it. Issue happens when you change the language in JIRA independently of the language set in Confluence.
fields.summary: Unable to create issue from Confluence if they have different languages due to priority translation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38953].
  {panel}

Currently, when you have an issue *Issue_A* which is linked to two other issues *Issue_B* and *Issue_C*. And you clone the three issues *A*, *B*, and *C* and move them to another project, the issues will maintain the same links with the original issues.

In some cases, it will be really helpful if the behaviour was changed to make those cloned issues to link to each other instead of linking to the original issues. An example use case of this would be as follows:
* Standard project for all test issues including dependencies (e.g. issues 1, 7 and 5 must pass before issue 10 can be tested)
* Those dependencies are described as issue links (e.g. issue 10 has links to issues 1, 7 and 5)
* Clone and move a subset of the test issues to a specific project xy.
* Cloned and moved test issues in the specific project xy are linked to its dependent issues (links point to the issues in project xy, NOT to issues in standard project)
fields.summary: Change the relation links between issues

fields.description:
Current behavior:
Old 'Autowatch' value is shown (until next refresh / page load)
Expected behavior:
'Autowatch' value should display new value (same as other updated values)

Steps to reproduce:
# Go to user profile
# Click edit user preferences
# Change autowatch value
# Save
=> Old value is shown
fields.summary: Update user preferences - autowatch - is not updated until refresh

fields.description:
To reproduce:
1. Launch JIRA
2. Write protect the attachment folder
3. Click Create to start creating a new issue
4. Fill out mandatory fields and add an attachment
5. Click Create
Result: A message telling me that the issue has been successfully created.
6. Open the issue and click on the attachment link
Result: Error page is shown

Note: Similarly, adding attachments to existing issues doesn't provide any feedback if it fails, the attachment dialog just "resets" and stays open.

For reference, cross posted from SDOG SAWA (Blobstore) where the example is if the remote Blobstore server is down: https://sdog.jira.com/browse/SAWA-286
fields.summary: No user feedback when attachment save fails due to a write-protected attachments folder in the filesystem
Upgrade jira to atlassian-gzip in version 1.21 for performance improvements

fields.description:
In the Atlassian Jira install4j windows executable (e.g. atlassian-jira-6.2.7-x64.exe), the i4j config appears to be expecting to be able to rename the tcnative-1.dll.x64 file in /bin directory. Installation log shows this fails as the file is not found. Necessary file is actually in an /bin/apr directory.

Please correct the i4j configuration or Jira install package so this works.

The [APR|http://tomcat.apache.org/native-doc/] adds non-blocking IO capability to Tomcat/Jira on Windows platforms, improving performance.

Workaround is to manually copy and rename the dll file after installation to ensure the file is located on the classpath.
fields.summary: Installer bug: tcnative-1.dll.x64

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38947].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When on the dashboard, if there are a large number of favourited dashboards the scrollbar disappears.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Favourite a large number of dashboards (more than appear on the screen).
# View the dashboard.
# Attempt to scroll to view the dashboards that are not shown.

h3. Expected Results

There is some way of accessing them (either via scrollbar or other UI magic).

h3. Actual Results

The dashboards do not appear.

h3. Workaround

Reduce the amount of favourited dashboards.
fields.summary: When a user has a large or extended amount of favourited dashboards there is no scroll bar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38946].
  {panel}

So, I use the JDK for all installs, most users I have also use this, the JDK comes with a jaxb reference impl as part of tools.jar.  The JIRA installer ships with a JRE lacking tools.jar.  This means users who using the installer encounter runtime exceptions if addons used JAXB and didn't _add_ their own implementation jar.

- https://thepluginpeople.atlassian.net/browse/JEMH-2544

Bamboo had the same thing: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-12484

It would be 'useful' if the JRE bundled with the JIRA installer had the referred JAXB impl jar.

I've added this into my addon, however, users upgrading are in a catch22, as it breaks startup _before_ they can upgrade.
fields.summary: JIRA installer ships with JRE, lacking JAXB default implementation
